<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 514, 90]]<|/det|>
A student determines the weight of a metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 87, 470, 106]]<|/det|>
She uses the apparatus shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
The metre rule is supported by a pivot at the \(10.0 \text{cm}\) mark and is suspended from a forcemeter by a loop of thread at the \(90.0 \text{cm}\) mark.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 148, 915, 384]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 401, 532, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 433, 146, 451]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 432, 680, 451]]<|/det|>
The student places a \(2.0 \text{N}\) weight at a distance \(l\) from the pivot.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 448, 920, 481]]<|/det|>
She then adjusts the height of the clamp holding the pivot so that the metre rule is horizontal. She reads the force \(F\) on the forcemeter.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 478, 626, 497]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.2 shows the weight and the metre rule from above.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 494, 532, 512]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.3 shows the reading on the forcemeter.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[265, 523, 730, 666]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 691, 591, 709]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label> (not to scale)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 721, 181, 740]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 721, 670, 740]]<|/det|>
Calculate the value of \(l\) from readings taken from Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 737, 418, 756]]<|/det|>
Show your working clearly.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[589, 813, 920, 831]]<|/det|>
<form>\(l = .................................................... \text{cm}\) [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the factors affecting the electrical output of a solar cell. A solar cell is a device which transforms light energy into electrical energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment which will enable him to investigate how the potential difference across the terminals of the solar cell varies with the angle of the incident light.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 398, 182]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 418, 213]]<|/det|>
a solar cell as shown in Fig. 4.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 212, 311, 228]]<|/det|>
a laboratory lamp.
